Cris Johnson.Action: Responds calmly and cooperatively to questioning, agrees to participate in testing without hostility.
Maintains a serene charisma despite being in a jail uniform and a locked chair, showing composed demeanor.
Calmly faces Homeland Security's interrogation and invites them to 'fire away' with questions.
Successfully focuses and accelerates perceived time on the digital clock to demonstrate his precognition ability.
Struggles quietly with physical restraints and emotional rage and panic as he experiences rapid forced time jumps without complaint or outbursts towards others.
Responds politely but dispassionately to waitress's friendly flirtation with a simple request for the check, showing no warmth or engagement in return.
Accurately navigates forward in time in small increments, reporting detailed observations (e.g., ants crawling up a tree) as requested.
Struggles physically when bound tightly to the chair, showing a loss of control and increasing panic as time jump speeds up and he is unable to stop or escape.
Despite being trapped and helpless, maintains situational awareness, noting his own aging and deteriorating physical state while trapped in the fast-forwarded timeline.
Sidesteps the Drunk, preventing him from spilling Daiquiri on himself and letting it spill on someone else instead.
States he only plays against the house and avoids playing against people, implying a respect toward others.
Says his goal is to go unnoticed and not to win big, suggesting restraint and maybe respect for the system or others.
Uses knowledge of quantum physics and multiple selves to anticipate and avoid getting spilled on by a drunk.
Deliberately avoids roulette and craps because a small change can unpredictably affect outcomes, showing strategic restraint.
Chooses to play only against the house and not against people, indicating thoughtful risk management.
Sets a goal to go unnoticed and avoid big wins to maintain long-term access to gambling opportunities.
Stops at the million-dollar slot machine, tempted but consciously resists the call to make a big bet, indicating self-control and discipline.
Approaches a desperate gambler on the verge of tears and encourages him to try the million dollar slot, even offering silver dollars.
Walks off when a Midwestern dowager takes the chance at the slot Cris suggested, resulting in her hitting the jackpot.
Uses careful judgment to avoid big bets and only takes calculated risks he controls.
Tries to help a desperate gambler with a tip based on a 'feeling' but does not follow through himself, demonstrating caution.
Chooses to walk away when a rival (Midwestern Dowager) takes the jackpot instead of pushing his luck.
Plays blackjack in a controlled fashion, emphasizing safe and boring strategy to avoid suspicion of counting cards.
Takes a hit and busts in blackjack, but this is consistent with a safe strategy (sticking with rules) rather than recklessness.
Appears relaxed and courteous at the blackjack table, female dealer tries not to gawk at him.
Beats six dealers in a row at blackjack while keeping his stacks short and moving frequently between tables.
Appears relaxed and confident at the table, causing visible distraction to the dealer.
Politely says 'Scuse me, sorry' after hurriedly jostling the waitress while pocketing chips and leaving quickly.
Avoids confrontation by hustling away and evading black suits instead of engaging them.
Keeps his chip stacks short while playing, showing awareness of risk and control.
Hurriedly pockets all his chips and smoothly leaves his seat when sensing danger, successfully evading pursuers.
Navigates the casino by zigzagging and using the slot aisles maze to avoid capture, demonstrating quick thinking and spatial awareness.
Uses bystanders (Texas-sized man and frat boys) to block Black Suits' view and evade capture
Moves between two aisles at last moment to avoid being seen by Black Suits.
Uses bystanders (Texas-sized man and frat boys) strategically to block line of sight of pursuers.
Enters one meeting room decisively, causing pursuers to split up and fail to catch him.
Pours olive oil to cause a Black Suit to slip and fall, allowing him to escape.
Evades multiple security guards with agility and without causing serious harm.
Recognizes Ferris from his prevision and immediately walks away to avoid her.
Uses olive oil from a room service cart to create a slippery trap that causes a pursuer to fall down.
Evades and disarms four large Black Suits using agility and skill, turning them into a pile on the floor.
Utilizes a loaded luggage cart to trick pursuers and switch sides to avoid detection.
Moves in a careful, calculated manner behind columns and at acute angles to avoid being spotted by multiple opponents.
Carefully avoids being seen by multiple pursuers, making precise movements to elude capture without causing harm.
Uses a guest’s suitcase to assist in his escape, indirectly causing the guest to collide with Ferris but does not engage aggressively.
Avoids being seen by multiple pursuers by precisely choosing movements and knowing where they will be looking, effectively achieving near invisibility.
Makes a quick and decisive escape by grabbing a guest's suitcase and slipping through a crowd despite being chased by Homeland Security agents.
Blends in unnoticed among laundry delivery men and escapes by climbing into a truck and concealing himself effectively.
Beams with perfect happiness while playing gently with a baby’s fingers.
Composes himself and steps out of the laundry truck nonchalantly, casually thanking workers.
Avoids trouble before he sees it, showing caution and foresight rather than recklessness.
Steps out of the laundry truck nonchalantly, composing himself like James Bond.
Avoids trouble before he sees it in the casino simulation.
States clearly that he can only see his own future, showing self-awareness about limits of his ability.
Observes accident but does not intervene, acknowledging it is usually none of his business.
Interacts casually and familiarly with the manager, using a nickname 'King Midas' suggesting friendly rapport.
Changes lanes to avoid getting stuck behind a truck and quickly reacts to a mattress falling off a truck causing an accident.
Monitors distant events such as plumes of smoke and uses glimpses of coming events to determine his actions.
Decides to exit highway purposefully and goes to a bookie shop with a confident code name 'King Midas'.
Admits most of the time he is not paying much attention, just trying to avoid trouble.
Greets Guy with a look and a hug, implying a friendly, warm reunion after some time apart.
Acknowledges needing to 'cash chips' and admits getting tagged, showing some level of sincerity and openness.
Attempts to lay low and manage his situation quietly, indicating a more reserved or cautious approach rather than engaging others warmly.
Returns to Guy to cash chips despite being tagged, showing awareness of his status and careful management of resources.
Tries to lay low after burning through his stash, indicating cautious behavior and a strategic mindset.
Is on a wanted bulletin for murder, suggesting involvement in serious trouble which might reflect poor choices impacting competence perception.
Tackles a customer who was about to kill another; tries to protect others despite customers' fear.
Runs out after seeing others afraid of him, showing some sensitivity to their feelings.
Admits to being drunk and that his engagement was broken off, displaying some sincerity and vulnerability.
Reacting with frustration when Guy calls Neal without consent.
Walks into a liquor store heavily intoxicated, behaves erratically, tackles a customer causing severe injury without clear reason.
Acknowledges his impaired state due to drunkenness and shows some self-awareness of personal failure.
Says sorry to hear about Neal's situation, showing some sympathy.
Jams the desk drawer shut with a penny, blocking Guy's access.
Explains his desire for freedom and not to be used any more, expressing personal values sincerely.
Tells Guy 'Enjoy it while it lasts.', a somewhat dismissive and cold remark.
Refuses to resume risky market play despite a lucrative offer, showing self-restraint and strategic thinking.
Jams the desk drawer shut with a penny, preemptively blocking Guy's access and demonstrating foresight and preparedness.
Claims he can stay ahead of the law forever, showing confidence in his ability to manage risks.
Grins cryptically and sets down espresso instead of drinking it, implying suspicion and alertness toward a potential threat.
Holds up a knife to stop Guy from reaching into his drawer, asserting control without violence, and calmly takes his cash before leaving.
Scoffs dismissively at Guy’s comment about knowing the future better.
Comes to fix dinner for a sick old man, shows physical affection and care despite difficult circumstances.
Engages in a warm, father-son like embrace with Irv, expresses sincere conversation about health and life decisions.
Comes back to a sick old man’s house to fix him dinner, showing care and reliability.
Maintains a warm relationship with Irv and understands the implications of his past smoking habit.
Aware of the severity of Irv's condition and engages in a meaningful conversation about life choices.
Cleans up Irv's messy house while they talk.
Refuses to turn himself in to avoid federal agencies knowing the truth, implying distrust and self-protection.
Expresses deep boredom and frustration with his life, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Keeps silent when asked what he has to do before leaving the country.
Cris cleans up the messy house while talking with Irv, showing some initiative and focus amid disorder.
Responds knowledgeably about consequences of telling the truth to authorities, indicating awareness and understanding of his situation.
Refuses to answer Irv's question about what he has to do first, demonstrating secrecy but also potentially withholding important information.
Expresses feeling trapped by his situation, repeatedly watching the news as punishment, suggesting a sense of helplessness and lack of control.
Makes a lamb roast for a guest, prepares his home thoughtfully.
Willing to stay and face the Fed because of the mother of his child.
Laughs with Irv and shows a light-hearted side.
Does not explain or defend himself aggressively to Irv's crude comments, maintains calm.
Invites Agent Ferris in politely, despite the circumstances.
Thinks carefully about not running away even when the Fed is coming, choosing to "play it out."
Carefully prepares a meal (lamb roast with garlic) and seemingly thinks through the situation calmly.
Selects a remote location (Palau) as a safe place where 'nothing ever happens,' showing strategic thinking.
Decides to wait for a specific person (mother of his child) rather than just running or choosing someone else, reflecting decisiveness and confidence.
Explains a physical trait confidently and uses humor to deflect a personal question, indicating self-assuredness.
Stops laughing abruptly and immediately opens the door for Agent Ferris upon sensing her arrival, showing alertness and adaptability.
Invites Ferris to speak privately and offers a comfortable setting by mentioning a roast in the oven.
Guards his reaction when confronted about killing a stranger to prevent harm, showing restraint and control.
Expresses distrust of using his gift and prefers to mind his own business despite others' encouragement.
Responds to Ferris’ serious concerns with a light-hearted, friendly remark ('Everyone but you, of course').
BOLTS away from Ferris and avoids testing, indicating distrust but no hostility.
Takes significant gunfire and endures pain but shows no aggression, suggesting a defensive rather than hostile posture.
Pulls out more than half the cash and sets it on the table without explanation, indicating a possible intent to help or be sincere.
Shows distant gaze and hesitation before revealing plans, suggesting internal conflict but no warmth indicator.
Bolts away immediately and uses the environment (diving to the floor) to avoid stun grenades and gas grenades, showing quick reflexes and tactical thinking.
Despite dodging bullets, gets hit multiple times and eventually falls, unable to fully escape the SWAT team’s assault.
Acknowledges the danger and plans to leave the country, showing awareness and foresight.
Fails to provide a clear explanation or plan when questioned by Irv, remaining vague and possibly distracted.
Attempts every possible treatment option for Irv but accepts when no options remain.
Carefully approaches his Camaro but is immediately ambushed by armed troopers, suggesting a failure to anticipate the trap.
Sneaks through an alley undetected past a state trooper who is distracted, demonstrating stealth and situational awareness.
Hitches a ride on the outskirts of Vegas, checking his watch precisely and planning his timing.
Approaches Liz Cooper with a friendly smile and asks to join her.
Persists politely with a different opening line when initially rejected by Liz.
Stares at Liz Cooper without invitation, making her scowl.
Orders coffee and a donut calmly, notices a vague reflection and attempts to investigate it.
Recognizes Liz Cooper as important to his future, attempts social interaction with confidence by approaching her and smiling.
Fails in initial attempt to engage Liz Cooper who rejects him bluntly; looks disconcerted.
Immediately tries a second approach after rejection with a casual question to engage Liz.
Approaches Liz multiple times despite rejection.
Accepts responsibility and apologizes sincerely after spilling coffee on Liz's shoes.
Shows vulnerability and regret with a miserable expression while cleaning up the mess.
Uses a clumsy but seemingly genuine way to connect with Liz (deliberately bobbles coffee but apologizes).
Continues interaction even after Liz is initially disgusted.
Tries multiple approaches to engage Liz, showing persistence and adaptability in social interaction.
Accidentally spills coffee, triggers initial embarrassment but uses it deliberately later to engage Liz.
Acknowledges mistake openly, apologizes sincerely, and actively tries to clean up the mess.
Initially fumbles social approach with a weak or hopeless opening line.
Sits and laughs easily with Liz, making light jokes.
Offers Liz a ride when she needs one, despite potential inconvenience.
Expresses sympathy about Liz's personal struggles (divorce, infertility) and quickly apologizes for prying.
Glances at watch and notes time but doesn't rush or pressure Liz.
Urgently takes control of the steering wheel to avoid traffic jam at roadblock, showing concern for their situation.
Scrambles for explanation and apologizes sincerely after upsetting Liz, admits to panicking and promises it won't happen again.
Forces the car off the road by jerking the steering wheel to avoid a traffic jam caused by a police roadblock, successfully preventing being stuck for hours.
Acts on impulsive panic by grabbing the steering wheel without consulting Liz, causing tension and being criticized for dangerous behavior.
Acknowledges mistake, apologizes sincerely, and promises not to repeat the reckless behavior, showing self-awareness and responsibility.
Asks Liz to stop at the next gas station and offers to fill up her tank.
Approaches Liz with a lottery card and sincerely apologizes repeatedly.
Offers to fill up the gas tank as a peace offer after panicking in traffic.
Uses a lottery card to distract Liz and successfully wins $250 unexpectedly.
Moves deliberately to refuel the car after winning the lottery money and apologizing.
Feeds Liz Kettle Chips and shares conversation about traveling peacefully.
Smiles honestly when Liz teases him; shows good-natured attitude.
Sings along with Liz in the car, creating a friendly, comfortable atmosphere.
Is reluctant to part from Liz and invites her for a drink, indicating friendliness and sincerity.
Invites Liz for a drink despite her initial refusal.
Steps between Liz and her aggressive ex to protect her.
Stands his ground calmly when confronted by Randy.
Does not escalate the conflict, identifies himself as 'just a friend'.
Stands his ground and calmly intervenes when Randy, a bigger and intimidating ex, blocks the way to Liz.
Orders his own drink decisively at the bar, showing social confidence.
Attempts to exit the bar when Liz says they need to leave quickly, demonstrating respect for social cues.
Fails to visibly escalate or de-escalate the confrontation with Randy beyond standing his ground; no clear resolution achieved in this excerpt.
Grips Randy's arm to de-escalate the situation, telling him 'Easy, man.'
Delivers a humiliating, painful beating to Randy, breaking his nose.
Realizes he has 'blown it' after Liz angrily tells him to get out, indicating awareness and possible regret.
Allows Liz to take care of him after being beaten, accepts her concern.
Apologizes for causing trouble to Liz.
Shows modesty by downplaying his act of standing up for Liz.
Despite injury, stays in Liz's company, appreciating her presence.
Does not resist Randy's attack and is physically beaten up, ending up on the floor.
Refuses medical help despite injury, showing stubbornness but possibly poor judgment.
Manages to stay in Liz's company despite being hurt, showing some social resilience.
Allows Liz to tend to his wounds without complaint; maintains eye contact showing sincerity and trustworthiness.
Pulls back from an almost kiss, respecting boundaries and Liz's hesitation.
Shares personal information about his failed almost-marriage and inability to have children when asked.
Does not push Liz for more intimacy and shows emotional restraint.
Looks at Liz with sympathy and comforts her when she is emotional.
Kisses Liz with quiet intensity and shares an intimate, tender moment.
After intimacy, floats in bed with Liz, eyes open, sadly content and appears afraid to lose the moment.
Forces himself to look away into the distance after the intimate moment.
Comforts Liz empathetically and responds sensitively in an intimate moment, showing awareness of her feelings and managing the situation with emotional intelligence.
Kisses Liz with quiet intensity and skillfully navigates their lovemaking with precision and attentiveness, demonstrating control, awareness, and mastery over the moment.
Forces himself to look away into the distance after an intimate moment, indicating potential internal conflict or distraction that might reduce his ability to be fully present or decisive.
Sits on the floor next to the heater, tries to fix it despite the difficulty, intentionally prolongs the task to avoid leaving.
Sits next to the heater, attempts to adjust the broken apparatus rather than abandoning it.
Uses a delaying tactic by implying the repair will take a long time to avoid immediate pressure.
Brings ice cream sandwiches for everyone, hoping to make Liz happy.
Feels crestfallen when Liz criticizes his gift but still offers to leave the ice cream anywhere as instructed.
Expresses desire to run away with Liz to the South Pacific, showing romantic optimism and sincerity.
Watching Liz work without offering help, showing boredom rather than engagement.
Expresses strong enthusiasm and conviction about leaving immediately despite practical concerns.
Dismisses Liz's responsibilities and practical objections lightly (e.g., 'They'll replace you') without showing concrete plans.
Acknowledges feelings and tries to rationalize urgency, but appears unprepared and desperate.
Offers his profile for hitting when Randy threatens him.
Participates politely in social introductions with Liz, Paul, and Janice.
Becomes distracted and does not intervene when dangerous driving leads to an accident.
Offers his profile for Randy to hit, showing calm confidence in a tense social situation.
Gets distracted at an important social interaction, failing to focus fully on the conversation.
Despite being spaced out initially, he quickly assesses the situation, takes a risk by throwing a rock to stop a speeding car and eventually succeeds in doing so, preventing an accident.
Shows hesitance before throwing the rock, initially missing several throws, indicating some uncertainty or lack of precision at first.
Demonstrates quick reflexes and physical skill by deftly deflecting the angry driver's punches, avoiding harm.
Attempts to resolve the confrontation calmly by offering to pay cash and avoiding police involvement.
Ignores people calling his name, indicating potential distraction or lack of social awareness momentarily.
Offers to pay cash to avoid police involvement, suggesting a pragmatic desire to resolve conflict quickly.
Insists that reckless drivers shouldn't get away with endangering children, showing concern for others’ safety.
Throws rocks at a reckless driver, demonstrating a willingness to take harsh action but also a protective instinct.
Shares a difficult personal confession with Liz despite her reluctance, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Takes a quarter from his pocket and encourages Liz to flip it multiple times to demonstrate his power.
Follows Liz despite her expressed desire to be left alone and says he can get them money.
Confesses to Liz that he can see the future and tries to demonstrate his ability with a coin flip prediction.
Insists on Liz believing him despite her discomfort and tries to convince her to join him in getting money.
Fails to understand or accept Liz's clear rejection and continues to follow her despite her expressed wishes for him to leave her alone.
Chooses his words carefully to hit the bull's-eye and soften Liz's demeanor.
Offers to have his doctor send medical records to build trust sincerely.
Seems unprepared when asked about his future plans.
Responds ambiguously about his future ('Wherever it takes me.') despite claiming to think about the future all the time.
Shares sincerely that his only wish is to have a family and openly admits his painful past, making light of it to cope.
Allows Liz to rest her head on his shoulder, showing openness to emotional closeness.
Expresses genuine appreciation for the scenic view and attempts affection with Liz.
Notices Liz's distance and asks her what is wrong, showing concern.
Appreciates the gorgeous view and engages with Liz emotionally, showing presence and awareness.
Kisses Liz but fails to detect her emotional distance or address it effectively.
Explains to Liz their meeting is the result of countless cosmic accidents, showing a thoughtful and sincere perspective.
Pours two glasses of Scotch and hands one to Liz, toasting to whatever happens next.
Expresses concern when Liz says she shouldn't drink.
Reassures Liz he wasn't lying about his previous problem and expresses sincere desire for the baby.
Holds Liz as she becomes emotional, showing support and tenderness.
Recognizes the significance of the pregnancy test image quickly, linking it to a past event he remembers.
Expresses confusion and inability to explain the situation fully.
Communicates honestly to Liz about his previous problem and his strong desire for the baby, showing emotional intelligence and sincerity.
Pours two glasses of Scotch and toasts without noticing Liz does not drink, showing some social awareness.
Unable to read Liz's reaction fully, indicating some limits in social perception.
Pauses before shouting when he finds himself locked in, showing restraint.
Calls Liz a 'lying bitch' and forcibly pulls her back by her robe, causing her to scream.
Tries to force open the locked bedroom door and checks for an escape route via the window, assessing his situation calmly.
Pauses before shouting for help, showing restraint and caution in a tense situation.
Fails to prevent Liz from escaping through the window initially and gets trapped by the bars sliding into place.
Whispers 'Liz, please, I love you' and promises not to hurt her while asking to talk.
Explains he killed a man to prevent harm to others, showing concern for innocent people.
Shares traumatic experience honestly and admits to avoiding going out to prevent further harm.
Reassures Liz and asks for her trust to follow his plan exactly, showing concern for her safety.
Tucks a note into Liz's robe pocket with instructions and encouragement, demonstrating care and thoughtfulness.
Mentions the harsh consequences he faces in a resigned way, without eliciting pity, focusing instead on practical escape plan.
Formulates a careful escape plan involving Liz with detailed contingencies like the thornbush and support arrival, showing foresight and strategic thinking.
Maintains calm and focused demeanor despite the dire situation, able to snap out of distraction quickly and communicate clearly.
Relies on others to execute the plan, asking Liz to follow detailed instructions, indicating trust and delegation.
Appears somewhat distracted temporarily, needing to be snapped back to reality.
Backs out from under Liz's robe discreetly and uses the sound of rustling to cover his escape.
Disarms an armed trooper and chooses not to shoot him, instead disables searchlights from a distance.
Boldly comes out from cover running into enemy fire, taking a calculated risk to exploit their ammo shortage.
Uses environmental distractions (the stag) to cause confusion among trained MPs, resulting in friendly fire.
Uses an enemy as a shield to protect himself and fires at another enemy.
Instead of firing at Cavanaugh when using Trooper Three as a shield, he shoves Trooper Three toward Cavanaugh, causing both to tumble down a slope.
Hops around like a mountain goat, narrowly avoiding gunfire, stays alive by a hair's breadth.
Rushes Trooper One and gets hit solidly in the chest.
Rushes Trooper Two and gets shot in the gut before reaching him.
Rushes Trooper Three, disarms him, takes his weapon, uses him as a shield, fires at Fourth Trooper.
When Cavanaugh charges in, doesn't fire but shoves Trooper Three at Cavanaugh, sending them tumbling down a slope.
Uses a premonition-like vision to foresee the State Police SUV crashing down the cliff and navigates toward that location to evade pursuers.
Ends up trapped in a steep ravine he cannot escape from.
Cris climbs in among the large boulders and waits calmly for the future to happen under threat of being shot.
Cris makes a run for it just as the SUV crashes and explodes on top of him, managing to escape.
Cris crouches down among the large boulders and waits calmly despite being surrounded and warned to surrender, demonstrating patience and situational awareness.
Successfully uses the explosion caused by the SUV crashing over the ledge to create a distraction and escape, showing resourcefulness and timing.
Avoids being hit or captured despite overwhelming numbers of troopers and MP's closing in, implying skill and agility.
Grins and exchanges lighthearted banter with Liz after a tense escape.
Reassures Liz by saying 'Believe me now?' in a moment of crisis, showing trust and camaraderie.
Focuses on escape and survival without apparent emotional expression beyond camaraderie, no signs of hostility or coldness.
Mud-skis down a treacherous mountain slope and uses momentum to reach the road quickly.
Successfully jumps into the police cruiser and accelerates despite three MPs hanging onto the car, maneuvering violently until they lose grip.
Confidently communicates and coordinates with Liz about their unpredictable escape plan and checks their ride via cell phone.
Reassures Liz while driving dangerously, focused on their safety despite the risks.
Communicates clearly about the urgency of getting to the airport on time.
Drives fast and dangerously on a treacherous road but concentrates carefully, avoids an accident and steers safely around an ice patch that causes another car to crash.
States that he never takes chances despite living dangerously, showing confidence and skill in handling risky situations.
Comforts Liz about their sterility and reassures her they are simply different and found the right match.
Drives aggressively at high speed taking blind curves, focusing on the task at hand without hesitation.
Takes blind curves at high speed skillfully and maneuvers perfectly through a maze of streets and alleys, avoiding traps and confrontation.
Engages in calm, confident conversation while focused on driving, demonstrating emotional control.
Maneuvers perfectly through the maze, avoiding traps and confrontation.
Blows the situation by driving toward a narrow canyon road with a one-lane bridge and a barricade of police cars.
Checks rearview mirror and assesses the dangerous situation with steep rock wall and vertical drop-off, but continues driving despite the high risk.
Slams on brakes to stop the car and orders others to get out immediately to avoid danger.
Hustles others out of the car before a deadly crash, showing concern for their safety.
Drives toward a specific segment of railing allowing others to escape harm as his vehicle is hit and crashes.
Leaps out of the falling car to save himself before impact.
Struggles to survive after jumping into dangerous rapids, ultimately grabbing a cable with handcuffs to save himself.
Leaps out of a falling car just before impact, showing quick response and physical agility.
Fights the fierce current and climbs onto a rock despite dangerous conditions, demonstrating physical resilience and situational awareness.
Realizes he is trapped near a waterfall and looks for a way out, showing problem recognition and pragmatic thinking.

Jumps off the rock into a dangerous waterfall area in desperation, signaling a willingness to take a significant risk when no other options are visible; competence ambiguous but leans positive for decisive action.
Clings to a cable attached to handcuffs despite initial misses and balance loss, showing persistence and the ability to recover quickly.
Advises Liz not to reveal her pregnancy and urges her to let the baby be born.
Declines to trust Ferris again despite her plea.
Comforts Liz by promising to get them out and reunite despite the grim situation.
Maintains a fatalistic attitude and does not share hope with Liz.
Attaches second cuff to other wrist, surrenders to capture; accepts situation without resistance.
Edges closer to Liz to communicate discreetly in the helicopter, gives important advice about pregnancy.
Expresses fatalism and doubts about escape despite proposing a plan, shaking his head indicating lack of confidence.
Sullenly complies with instructions to step into the next room despite being restrained and tested.
Struggles to lift the shackles restrained by electromagnets and then sullenly steps forward when unable to free himself.
Lightly jokes about being hit by paintballs, 'You're paying for the shirt.'
Stands unafraid and composed in a dangerous situation, ready to face live fire.
Balances focus and quick reflexes to protect himself from harm without showing fear.
Stands unafraid facing rifles loaded with paintballs, showing calmness and confidence.
Jokes about the paintball hits, keeping composure and lightening the situation.
Confidently interjects to confirm that the next shots will be real bullets, indicating awareness and control.
Lunges and dodges multiple live bullets with agility and precision, demonstrating high physical skill and situational awareness.
Stops suddenly and stands still as an easy target, causing guns to run out of ammunition.
Complies without complaint by stepping into the electrified room voluntarily, showing cooperation and trust despite suspicion.
Mentions 'No need for a hotfoot' indicating a polite or understated acknowledgment rather than resistance or hostility.
Eyes the chair with suspicion, indicating wariness or distrust.
Avoids being hit by six gunshots automatically aimed by infrared targeting.
Walks calmly into an electrified room without resistance after foreseeing the consequences.
Refuses to cooperate with Ferris, choosing to resist despite knowing he will be shocked.
Shoots Ferris the finger after being ordered to sit in the chair again.
Recognizes the situation and resists the coercive tactics despite anticipating punishment.
Refuses to cooperate and gets incapacitated, failing to achieve his goals in this interaction.
Only ever used his extraordinary ability for minor gambling and securities fraud rather than for grander, more impactful purposes.
Possesses an extraordinary predictive capability that can be developed to foresee distant futures, allowing for precise pre-emptive strikes and repeated scenario testing.
Dashes between MPs and tries to escape despite being beaten down.
Responds 'I don't believe you' to Wisdom's request for help and apology.
Uses martial arts to resist the MP's repeatedly, showing defiance against authority trying to control him.
Attempts to bar the door to prevent MP's entry, showing protective behavior (possibly self-protective rather than towards others).
Considers the plea about his obligation to save lives but focuses on perfecting escape instead.
Executes a precisely choreographed and efficient escape, avoiding unnecessary harm to the MPs and locking them safely behind a door.
Relives and refines the martial arts attack repeatedly, improving skill through anticipation and economy of movement.
Executes a perfectly choreographed escape by slipping past MPs and locking the door behind him.
Shoots Wisdom in the shin and threatens others to stop them from shooting him.
Elegantly slips past all the MP's into the hall and locks them in, creating an effective escape.
Obtains Ferris's gun and confidently disarms and incapacitates Wisdom and Baines with precise shots and commands.
Quickly reads the environment under heavy fire, dives and uses doors opening at the right moment to shield himself from gunfire.
Grabs a gun from an adversary and opens fire to cover his retreat, allowing him to continue evading pursuers.
Stops to think briefly before charging out shooting and fighting, efficiently completing multiple complex tasks under pressure.
Retrieves a gun and fires to create cover, then uses coordinated, quick thinking and physical actions to escape danger.
Communicates covertly to Liz off-camera, instructing her to 'unscrew the vent' so she can help him escape.
Reaches around and grabs someone's gun. Opens fire to buy cover, thinks, then charges out shooting, fighting, running -- completing a condensed burst of four impossible tasks to reach a refuge point.

Waits, thinks, charges, and performs another choreographed burst of action to enter an elevator as the doors open, shoots while pressing elevator buttons to move several stories up and waits for doors to close.
Climbs up through elevator ceiling panel and then rips open a ventilation duct to enter the shaft and continue movement stealthily.
Frustrated but patient hiding in the ventilation duct to avoid capture without confrontation.
Maintains calm and focus while escaping, avoiding unnecessary conflict with security forces.
Uses a time manipulation ability (snapback) to avoid capture by Security Police by hiding just before they arrive.
Crawling out of his own motionless body like shedding skin, showing skillful use of his unusual abilities.
Remains remarkably calm and preternaturally confident as he moves through dangerous territory.
Ends up found by soldiers and flashlights in the vent shaft, indicating his plan was initially being foiled.
Hides in different rooms and searches through desk drawers, putting things in his pockets.
Fights Security Police to take their guns but is ultimately killed.
Observes security patrols carefully to piece together their schedule and rescue Liz.
Follows MPs who escort Liz and gets seen by her, indicating concern for her safety.
Composes his thoughts, takes a breath, then proceeds cautiously without leaving a trail, showing careful planning and control.
Loads specific objects into a backpack without hesitation, indicating knowledge and readiness.
Spray-paints over surveillance cameras systematically and effectively to avoid detection.
Breaks soldiers' shooting arms, tapes their mouths, and forcibly disarms them.
Uses minimum necessary force to incapacitate soldiers, employing chokeholds and punches instead of lethal violence.
Breaks an enemy's shooting arm, disarms two soldiers, and efficiently neutralizes them by taping their mouths.
Uses floor polish strategically to make enemies slip, then incapacitates them with minimal force.
Lies in wait and swiftly incapacitates enemy guard dogs and soldiers using mace before they can respond.
Charges into a room after a tear gas canister is thrown, wearing a gas mask and immediately counterattacks by destroying surveillance monitors.
Charges in wearing a gas mask and shoots at video monitors to blind opponents.
Shoots two MPs without looking, causing harm to others.
Maces the last of the dogs to disable them.
Breaks Crack Shot's arm before Crack Shot can fire.
Sneaks into the room where Liz will be brought, presumably to protect or help her.
Puts his fist over his heart as a gesture of love to Liz while hiding, signaling care and support.
Leaves a note saying 'GO CRAZY!' to encourage Liz before she is captured, showing encouragement and connection.
Sneaks away and hides to avoid detection, showing caution but not directly confronting danger for others.
Hides successfully from MPs who expect to find him.
Communicates covertly with Liz by slipping a note and making a subtle gesture of love.
Uses distraction (Liz screaming and running wildly) to create an opportunity to slip inside the room unnoticed.
Slips inside a room just as Baines checks, closing the door behind him without detection.
Steps out of hiding and quickly subdues Ferris by putting his forearm around her neck, taking her hostage without alerting others.
Emerges from the office with Ferris as his hostage, demonstrating control over the situation and careful timing to avoid detection.
Holds Ferris hostage to escape, staying focused despite threat to his girlfriend.
Takes Ferris as a hostage and uses him as leverage to move through the building despite the presence of armed patrols.
Holds gun to hostage's head when confronted by armed patrol, demonstrating control and confidence.
Responds to threats and warnings calmly, showing focus under pressure.
Ignores the threat to his girlfriend and challenges Wisdom's ultimatum, indicating confidence but potential risk-taking.
Shifts Ferris to protect him from a sniper's shot, showing protective behavior.
Fires a shot to wing a substitute sniper, preventing the sniper from shooting at him.
Tosses a grenade to create a distraction, possibly putting others at risk without hesitation.
Forces a soldier to give him keys, threatens to kill Ferris if the soldier intervenes.
Engages in light, somewhat sincere banter with Ferris, acknowledging misunderstandings and willingness to cooperate.
Accepts Ferris' offer to start from scratch and cooperation, taking her card despite the tension.
Holds gun threateningly to Ferris' head despite conversation about cooperation.
Commands a soldier to give him the keys, quickly takes control of the vehicle and escapes successfully.
Uses intimidation effectively by threatening the soldier to ensure compliance.
Demonstrates quick wit and rapport with Ferris, mirroring her statements to maintain control of the interaction.
Flips Ferris' card out the window, potentially losing a helpful contact.
Shoves Ferris in front of him as a shield to protect Liz and charges the threat to save her.
Quaking with rage and prepares to shoot Ferris after seeing Liz dead.
Prepares to shoot Ferris in rage upon seeing Liz dead.
Charges down stairwell dragging Ferris, using him as a shield while moving quickly to evade and counter attack.
Fires blindly around a corner and successfully kills a would-be assassin.
Shoots Security Police efficiently, killing one per bullet, prioritizing threat order.
Stops in his tracks quaking with rage after Ferris accuses him of lacking duty.
Uses Ferris as a human shield while shooting his way through armed personnel.
Threatens technicians to get them to flee and locks himself and Ferris inside for protection.
Drags Ferris while under fire, uses Ferris as a human shield, shoots his way into the forensic lab, and forces technicians to flee.
Quickly learns the bomb detonation mechanism through trial and error, even after initially blowing himself up multiple times before figuring out the correct method.
Persistent in facing overwhelming security forces and manages to kill Wisdom despite heavy opposition.
Gets shot and chopped to pieces multiple times during confrontation indicating vulnerability and failure to avoid harm despite skill.
Helps Liz from her perch after the explosion by extending a hand.
Focuses on moving and setting the bomb with eyes closed, showing concentration but no overt emotional connection.
Uses repeated time-snapping to safely learn how to detonate the bomb, blowing himself up multiple times but ultimately figures out the correct method.
Calmly sets the bomb detonator to 10 seconds after careful consideration.
Successfully escapes the bomb blast by running and diving at the last moment, demonstrating precise timing and situational awareness.
Helps Liz escape from a dangerous position after the explosion.
Appears unnoticed and is met with shock by Neal and others, indicating possible failure to anticipate others’ emotional states or situations.
Watches Liz leave the plane, looking bereft and shedding tears, showing emotional vulnerability and connection.
Expresses willingness to cooperate by reaching out to Ferris despite his despondency.
Refuses to be forced into slavery despite the pressure, indicating a defensive and possibly distrustful stance.
Expresses being unable to prevent disaster and feels forced into an unfavorable situation.
Has no futures left to choose from and shows emotional breakdown (tears escaping his eyes).
Despite despondency, takes initiative to contact Ferris and expresses desire to cooperate.
Sits next to Liz tenderly, looks at her like an angel, expresses desire to be with her forever, and reveals they are going to have a child despite difficulty.
Holds back tears, shows misery and vulnerability in front of Liz.
Leaves Liz despite emotional connection and her pleas, prioritizing a vague 'something he has to do'.
Shows emotional restraint and stays committed to a difficult decision despite personal pain.
Fails to effectively communicate his reasons, causing confusion and hurt in Liz.
Calmly gets into the car and engages with Ferris, showing readiness to explain his talent in a thoughtful way.
Uses a metaphor about the future changing when observed to explain his ability, indicating reflective and intelligent communication.
